sentences.en: Do not be infatuated with pride.
He is infatuated with her, and doesn't see her faults.
sentences.cn: 他对她着了迷, 看不出她的缺点.

sentences.en: He is infatuated with that girl.
He was infatuated with the beautiful girl.
sentences.cn: 他为那姑娘的美貌所倾倒.

sentences.en: He was utterly infatuated with her.
He was wildly infatuated with Emillia.
sentences.cn: 他如醉如痴地迷恋着埃米莉亚.

sentences.en: He's infatuated with his own importance.
sentences.cn: 他自以为了不起而飘飘然.
他对那位姑娘是一片痴情.

sentences.en: I am scarcely infatuated with the sweetness of my native air.
sentences.cn: 故乡甜蜜的空气很难使我迷恋.

sentences.en: I became infatuated with the case.
Infatuated with Queen Cleopatra of Egypt, Antony lost his will to fight.
sentences.cn: 安东尼沉迷于埃及女王克娄帕特拉的美色, 失去了斗志.

sentences.en: She was completely infatuated with him.
She's infatuated by his good looks.
sentences.cn: 她迷恋上他那俊俏的外貌了.

words.tran_cn: 使糊涂；使冲昏头脑；使迷恋

trans.tran_en: having strong feelings of love for someone or a strong interest in something that makes you unable to think in a sensible way

trans.tran_cn: 冲昏头脑( infatuate的过去式和过去分词 )
